_meta.source: NBA Trade History Research - Deep Analysis

tree.name: Karl-Anthony Towns
tree.tradeDescription: NYK acquires KAT for Julius Randle + Donte DiVincenzo + protected first
tree.note: 4x All-Star, 2015 #1 pick. Towns-for-Randle centerpiece deal to improve spacing.

assetsGivenUp.name: Julius Randle
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Sign-and-trade from Pelicans: Randle to NYK for nothing (cap space)
assetsGivenUp.note: 3x All-Star, 2x All-NBA. Originally Lakers draft pick traded to NOLA.

assetsGivenUp.name: Julius Randle (Lakers period)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Randle to NOLA as part of Lakers clearing space for LeBron/other FAs
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers used Randle's departure to create max cap space

assetsGivenUp.name: Julius Randle (draft rights)
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers finished 27-55 in 2013-14. Suffered broken leg as rookie.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2014 #7 Overall Pick
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Lakers' own pick - poor season result
assetsGivenUp.note: Post-Kobe era rebuilding. Lakers were 27-55 in 2013-14

assetsGivenUp.name: Donte DiVincenzo
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Acquired from Warriors for future 2nd-round considerations
assetsGivenUp.note: 2021 NBA Champion with Milwaukee, Villanova connection to NYK culture

assetsGivenUp.name: 2024 Second-Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: NYK's own 2024 second-round pick sent to GSW for DiVincenzo

assetsGivenUp.name: Keita Bates-Diop
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Signed as free agent from San Antonio Spurs
assetsGivenUp.note: Salary filler, journeyman forward. Free agent = no assets given up

assetsGivenUp.name: 2025 First-Round Pick (via DET, protected 1-13)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Acquired from Detroit in Cam Reddish facilitator deal
assetsGivenUp.note: DET's pick conveyed at #17 (outside 1-13 protection). Went to MIN in KAT trade.

assetsGivenUp.name: Trade Facilitation Services
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK helped facilitate Detroit trade by taking on contracts
assetsGivenUp.note: Used roster flexibility to acquire future asset

assetsGivenUp.name: Roster Flexibility
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK maintained roster flexibility specifically for trade opportunities
